intro: Camissonia claviformis subsp. peirsonii, commonly known as the Sierra Valley bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped blue to purple flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow, elongated leaves and specific habitat preferences, often growing in moist, open areas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is adapted to thrive in coastal and mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
